properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 12 at 5:14AM CST until February 13 at 6:27PM CST by NWS Birmingham AL
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in Alabama...

Tallapoosa River At The Tallapoosa Water Plant Affecting Elmore and
Montgomery Counties.

.Heavy rainfall from the past 2 days continues to produce rises on
the Tallapoosa River at the Tallapoosa Water Plant and water levels
are now rising into minor flood stage. Minor flooding is expected
to continue through tomorrow in the surrounding low lying areas...A
flood warning is now in effect.

The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Tallapoosa River At The Tallapoosa Water Plant.
* until Thursday evening...or until the warning is cancelled.
* At  4:00 AM Wednesday The stage Was 25 feet.
* Flood stage is 25 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue rising to near 26.1 feet by this
evening. The river will fall below flood stage tomorrow morning .
* Impact...At 25 feet...Lower Wetumpka Road starts to flood.
Extensive flooding of low lands occurs and livestock and farm
equipment should be moved to higher ground. At 20 feet...Creeks
start to back up and cut off access to pastures. A few secondary
roads begin to flood. At 15 feet...Low areas near the junction
with the Coosa River begin to overflow.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas.  Turn Around...Don't Drown.

Another statement will be issued by Thursday morning...or sooner if
conditions warrant.
